member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications
member.summary: Specifies events which the invokes to enable developer control over the authentication process. />

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new set of notifications. Each notification has a default no-op behavior unless otherwise documented.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.AuthenticationFailed
member.summary: Invoked if exceptions are thrown during request processing. The exceptions will be re-thrown after this event unless suppressed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.AuthorizationCodeReceived
member.summary: Invoked after security token validation if an authorization code is present in the protocol message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.MessageReceived
member.summary: Invoked when a protocol message is first received.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.RedirectToIdentityProvider
member.summary: Invoked to manipulate redirects to the identity provider for SignIn, SignOut, or Challenge.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.SecurityTokenReceived
member.summary: Invoked with the security token that has been extracted from the protocol message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications.SecurityTokenValidated
member.summary: Invoked after the security token has passed validation and a ClaimsIdentity has been generated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new
member.remarks:
Defaults:
AddNonceToRequest: true.
AuthenticationMode: .
BackchannelTimeout: 1 minute.
Caption: .
ProtocolValidator: new .
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound: true
ResponseType:
Scope: .
TokenValidationParameters: new with AuthenticationType = authenticationType.
UseTokenLifetime: true.
member.param: will be used to when creating the for the AuthenticationType property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Authority to use when making OpenIdConnect calls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.CallbackPath
member.summary: An optional constrained path on which to process the authentication callback. If not provided and RedirectUri is available, this value will be generated from RedirectUri.
member.remarks: If you set this value, then the will only listen for posts at this address. If the IdentityProvider does not post to this address, you may end up in a 401 -> IdentityProvider -> Client -> 401 -> ...

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.BackchannelCertificateValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the a pinned certificate validator to use to validate the endpoints used when retrieving metadata.
member.remarks: If this property is null then the default certificate checks are performed, validating the subject name and if the signing chain is a trusted party.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.BackchannelHttpHandler
member.summary: The HttpMessageHandler used to retrieve metadata. This cannot be set at the same time as BackchannelCertificateValidator unless the value is a WebRequestHandler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.BackchannelTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout when using the backchannel to make an http call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Caption
member.summary: Get or sets the text that the user can display on a sign in user interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'client_id'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'client_secret'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration provided directly by the developer. If provided, then MetadataAddress and the Backchannel properties will not be used. This information should not be updated during request processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.RequireHttpsMetadata
member.summary: Gets or sets if HTTPS is required for the metadata address or authority. The default is true. This should be disabled only in development environments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.MetadataAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the discovery endpoint for obtaining metadata

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.ConfigurationManager
member.summary: Responsible for retrieving, caching, and refreshing the configuration from metadata. If not provided, then one will be created using the MetadataAddress and Backchannel properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound
member.summary: Gets or sets if a metadata refresh should be attempted after a SecurityTokenSignatureKeyNotFoundException. This allows for automatic recovery in the event of a signature key rollover. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Notifications
member.summary: Gets or sets the to notify when processing OpenIdConnect messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.ProtocolValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used ensure the 'id_token' received is valid per: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDTokenValidation

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.PostLogoutRedirectUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'post_logout_redirect_uri'
member.remarks: This is sent to the OP as the redirect for the user-agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.RedirectUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'redirect_uri'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'resource'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.ResponseType
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'response_type'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'scope'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.SignInAsAuthenticationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the AuthenticationType used when creating the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.StateDataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the type used to secure data handled by the middleware.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.SecurityTokenValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to validate identity tokens.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.TokenValidationParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the TokenValidationParameters
member.remarks: Contains the types and definitions required for validating a token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.UseTokenLifetime
member.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions.CookieManager
member.summary: An abstraction for reading and setting cookies during the authentication process.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.ArgsException_BackchallelLessThanZero
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to BackchannelTimeout cannot be less or equal to TimeSpan.Zero..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.Exception_OpenIdConnectMessageError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to "OpenIdConnectMessage.Error was not null, indicating an error. Error: '{0}'. Error_Description (may be empty): '{1}'. Error_Uri (may be empty): '{2}'.".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.Exception_RedirectUri_LogoutQueryString_IsNotWellFormed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to OIDC_20001: The query string for Logout is not a well formed URI. The runtime cannot redirect. Redirect uri: '{0}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Resources.Exception_ValidatorHandlerMismatch
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An ICertificateValidator cannot be specified at the same time as an HttpMessageHandler unless it is a WebRequestHandler..
